message.content:
It is possible to install Windows 10 on MacBook Pro, but you'll need to use a program called Boot Camp Assistant that comes pre-installed in macOS. Here's how:

1. Make sure your MacBook Pro meets the minimum system requirements for running Windows 10 and has at least 64GB of free storage space.

2. Obtain the necessary components:
- A USB flash drive with at least 16 GB of storage space (optional but recommended).
- A copy of the Windows 10 ISO file.
    - To download it, go to Microsoft's website (https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windowsISO)
    - Select "Windows 10" as the edition
    - Choose a language (e.g., English)
    - Select either "64-bit Download." 

3. Plug your USB flash drive into one of your MacBook Pro ports if applicable.

4. Open Boot Camp Assistant from Applications > Utilities folder or search for it using Spotlight Search.

5. In Boot Camp Assistant, click Continue and follow the on-screen instructions.

6.First select “Download latest updates” if prompted

7.Select Create bootable disk from here upload windows iso file downloaded earlier
